adjectives.description: resty (comparative more resty, superlative most resty)

entries.meaning: (now regional) Restive, resistant to control. [from 16th c.]
examples: I could not come a moment sooner; I hardly expected to get here at all, for my horse has been so confounded resty I could not tell how to get him along.

entries.meaning: (now regional) Disposed to rest; inactive, lazy. [from 16th c.]
examples: […]  all [beef] is rejected and unfit for such as lead a resty life, anyways inclined to melancholy, or dry of complexion  […]
